title: Reading 1: Weather Around the World

subQuestions.q: How is the weather in Thailand?
subQuestions.explanation: Looking at the picture for Thailand, we can see rain falling from the clouds and a person holding an umbrella. Therefore, the weather is rainy.

subQuestions.q: What is the weather like in Kuwait?
subQuestions.explanation: The picture for Kuwait shows a bright sun and a thermometer indicating a high temperature (hot). There are no clouds, rain, or snow shown. Thus, it is hot and sunny.

title: Reading 2: City Weather Chart

subQuestions.q: Ernie lives in City C. What might he say?
options: (A) It snows a lot in January here.
(B) It's cool and rainy in July.
(C) We have a lot of rain in April.
(D) It's windy and snowy in October.
subQuestions.explanation: According to the chart for City C, the weather symbol for April shows a cloud with rain. Therefore, Ernie would say they have a lot of rain in April.

subQuestions.q: Tony lives in City A, and it is a sunny day today. What month is it now?
subQuestions.explanation: Looking at the row for City A, the symbol for July represents a sunny day (a sun). The symbols for other months show clouds or rain. So, it must be July.

subQuestions.q: How is the weather in April in City B?
subQuestions.explanation: Check the intersection of 'City B' and 'April' on the chart. The symbol shows an umbrella with rain drops, which means it is rainy.

title: Reading 3: Trip to Kenting
article:
Ken: Hey, Amy. That's an orange coat. Why are you in it? You hate the color.
Amy: Well, it's so cold today and my jacket isn't warm enough. I want to go to a warm place this weekend. Do you have any ideas?
Ken: What about Kenting? It is always sunny there.
Amy: That's great.
Ken: I have some good friends there. Let's visit them.
Amy: Cool! You sent me postcards from Kenting before, and I'll send my family some this time.

subQuestions.q: Why does Amy wear a coat?
options: (C) Amy likes the coat very much.
(D) She wants to go to Kenting.
subQuestions.explanation: Amy says, 'it's so cold today and my jacket isn't warm enough.' This explains that she is wearing the orange coat because the weather is very cold.

subQuestions.q: Why do Ken and Amy want to go to Kenting?
subQuestions.explanation: Ken suggests Kenting by saying, 'It is always sunny there.' Amy responds, 'That's great.' This implies they want to go there because of the sunny weather.

subQuestions.q: Which is true(正確的)?
options: (B) It is always cold in Kenting.
(C) It is snowy in Kenting this weekend.
(D) Ken has some friends in Kenting.
subQuestions.explanation: In the dialogue, Ken explicitly states: 'I have some good friends there [in Kenting].' Therefore, (D) is true.

title: Reading 4: Seasonal Weather Chart

subQuestions.q: Eric lives in City 3, and it snows a lot. What season is it now?
subQuestions.explanation: Looking at the chart for City 3, the 'Winter' column shows a snowman symbol, which indicates snow. Therefore, it is Winter.

subQuestions.q: How is the weather in City 2 in autumn?
subQuestions.explanation: First, we know that 'Fall' is another word for 'autumn'. Looking at the chart for City 2 under the 'Fall' column, there is a sun symbol. This means the weather is sunny.

title: Reading 5: Visiting Yilan
article:
Mia: Do you know Yilan?
Ben: Yes, it rains very often in winter.
Mia: How's the weather there in summer?
Ben: It's always hot and wet, but many people like Yilan a lot.
Mia: You're right. My parents and I sometimes have trips to Yilan.
Ben: What do you do there?
Mia: We visit our grandparents and join Children's Folklore and Folkgame Festival. We always have a good time.
Ben: That's cool!
Mia: These are for you. Some snacks from Yilan!
Ben: Thanks!

subQuestions.q: What's the weather like in Yilan in winter?
subQuestions.explanation: Ben asks about Yilan, and replies to himself saying: 'Yes, it rains very often in winter.' This confirms that Yilan is rainy in winter.

subQuestions.q: Why do Mia and her parents go to Yilan?
options: (B) They have a snack shop there.
subQuestions.explanation: Mia says, 'We visit our grandparents and join Children's Folklore and Folkgame Festival.' This matches option (C).

title: Reading 6: Two Summers
article:
(Cody is talking to his friend from Australia.)
Cody: Do you like the weather in Taiwan?
Tony: Of course. You know what? I had two summers in a year, and I enjoyed lots of sunny days.
Cody: What do you mean?
Tony: My first summer was from December to February in Australia, and my second summer was from June to August in Taiwan. I'm a summer guy, so I love it.
Cody: That's great. How about the food in Taiwan? Do you like it?
Tony: Yeah! I went to a night market with some mates the other day. We had fried chook. It was great.
Cody: I didn't get it. Who did you go to the night market with, and what did you have?
Tony: Sorry about my Australian English. I went with some friends, and we had fried chicken.
Cody: I see. I learned some Australian English today!
Tony: Good for you! Maybe you can come see me in Australia next year, and we can have fun together.

subQuestions.q: What did Tony say about Australia's summer?
options: (A) It is usually about four months long.
(B) It is cool and doesn't have many sunny days.
(C) It has strange weather, so he hates it.
(D) It falls in different months from Taiwan's summer.
subQuestions.explanation: Tony mentions his first summer was 'from December to February in Australia' and his second was 'from June to August in Taiwan.' This shows that Australia's summer happens in different months compared to Taiwan's summer.

subQuestions.q: Why did Cody say I didn't get it?
options: (B) He didn't like the weather in Taiwan.
(C) He didn't know much about Australian English.
(D) He didn't go to Australia before.
subQuestions.explanation: Tony used the phrase 'fried chook'. Cody didn't understand what 'chook' meant. Tony then explained it means 'fried chicken' and apologized for his 'Australian English'. So Cody didn't get it because he didn't know the Australian slang.

title: Reading 7: Letter to Mom
article:
Dear Mom,
I know you are busy working in Taipei, but I have a big problem about my new school. I need your help.
I am afraid of talking to my new classmates. I got into the class for two weeks, but I have no friends to talk to. I usually feel lonely, and I don't like new school life. What can I do?
Sam

******************

My dear boy,
I know it's difficult to be a transfer student, but I am sure you can do it in a good way. Don't just wait for your classmates to talk to you. You can hold out your hand to them.
Be nice to people around you, and they will be nice to you. By the way, I will come back to Tainan next Saturday evening. We can have a big dinner.
Mom
Sandra

subQuestions.q: Why DOESN'T Sam like his new school life?
options: (A) Because he doesn't like his teachers.
(D) Because he doesn't live near the school.
subQuestions.explanation: Sam writes: 'I have no friends to talk to. I usually feel lonely, and I don't like new school life.' The lack of friends is the reason.

subQuestions.q: What is the relationship(關係)between Sam and Sandra?
subQuestions.explanation: Sam addresses the letter to 'Dear Mom', and Sandra signs her reply as 'Mom'. Sandra calls Sam 'My dear boy'. This clearly indicates a mother and son relationship.

subQuestions.q: Which is right about the e-mails(電子郵件)?
options: (B) Sandra will come back to Taipei next Saturday.
(C) Sam's new school is in Tainan.
(D) Sam lives with her mom in Taipei.
subQuestions.explanation: Sandra writes: 'I will come back to Tainan next Saturday evening.' This implies Sam is currently in Tainan (where his new school is), and Sandra is working in Taipei (as Sam mentions in his first line). Thus, Sam's new school is in Tainan.

title: Reading 8: Postcard from India
article:
Dear Matt,
I'm now in India with my friend Theo.
It's cool here in winter. The weather is just lovely. Yesterday, we were on a train for about seven hours. There were many people on the train, and we didn't have a seat. But you know what? A man and his son gave their seats to us. They were so kind. Also, Theo and I bought bags in a shop near our hotel. I bought one for you as a gift, too. It is big and special. Maybe we can take a trip here together next year. India is a really beautiful place.
Your friend,
Evans

subQuestions.q: What does it mean in the reading?
subQuestions.explanation: The text says: 'Theo and I bought bags... I bought one for you as a gift, too.' Here, 'one' refers back to the 'bags' they bought. So 'it' (the gift) is a bag.

subQuestions.q: Where did Evans send the postcard to?
subQuestions.explanation: The recipient address on the postcard is: 'Matt Demoss, No. 361, Green Park St., Taipei 106, Taiwan (ROC)'. So it was sent to Taiwan.

subQuestions.q: What do we know from the reading?
options: (A) Evans liked the trip in India.
(B) Evans went to India with Matt.
(D) Evans stood for seven hours on the train.
subQuestions.explanation: Evans writes: 'India is a really beautiful place' and 'The weather is just lovely'. This shows he liked the trip. He went with Theo, not Matt. He stood on the train for a while, but a man gave them seats, so he didn't stand for the full seven hours.

title: Reading 9: Brazil and Taiwan
article: Brazil and Taiwan have different summer weather. First, Brazil's summer is from December to February, but Taiwan's summer is from June to September. In Brazil, the weather is hot and wet, with days around 30 to 35°C. Taiwan is also hot, around 28 to 35°C. Also, Brazil has a lot of rain. Taiwan has a lot of rain too, but typhoons are a big problem. They come with strong winds and heavy rain. Both places are hot and wet in summer.

subQuestions.q: What can be the title (標題) of this reading?
options: (A) Hot Summer and the Weather in the World
(B) The Summer Weather in Taiwan and Brazil
(C) Heavy Rain and Strong Typhoons in Taiwan
(D) Brazil Has Different Weather in Different Places
subQuestions.explanation: The passage compares the summer weather, months, and conditions (rain/heat) in Brazil and Taiwan. Therefore, 'The Summer Weather in Taiwan and Brazil' is the best title.

subQuestions.q: Which of the following places may be Brazil?
subQuestions.explanation: The text states Brazil's summer is from December to February, and it is hot (30-35°C) and has a lot of rain. Graph (D) shows high temperatures and high rainfall in the months of Jan, Feb, and Dec, which matches the description.

subQuestions.q: Which of the following can we put in the middle (中間)?
subQuestions.explanation: The Venn diagram asks for the common feature between Taiwan and Brazil. The text says: 'Both places are hot and wet in summer.' It also mentions different months and typhoons only for Taiwan. Thus, the commonality is 'Hot weather in summer'.

title: Reading 10: Steven's Trip
article:
Dear Grandma,
My trip to Australia was fun! It's usually warm and rainy in Taiwan, but it was cold and snowy! During my trip, Uncle Ben took me to high mountains and we played with snow. I got a new jacket from Aunt Holly for my birthday and Uncle Ben made cookies and hot chocolate milk for me. When we were at their house, they showed me some old pictures. I was so small and cute when I was a baby. Anyway, see you in Taiwan soon. There are somes gifts from Uncle Ben and Aunt Holly for you.
Steven

subQuestions.q: How was the weather in Australia during Steven's trip?
subQuestions.explanation: Steven writes: 'it was cold and snowy!' and mentions playing with snow. So the weather was cold and snowy.

subQuestions.q: Who did Steven meet in Australia?
subQuestions.explanation: Steven mentions 'Uncle Ben took me to high mountains' and 'I got a new jacket from Aunt Holly'. He stayed at their house. So he met Ben and Holly.

subQuestions.q: Which is NOT right?
options: (A) Steven had a good time in Australia.
(B) Aunt Holly gave a jacket to Steven.
(C) Uncle Ben bought pictures of a cute baby for Steven.
(D) Steven played with snow in high mountains.
subQuestions.explanation: The letter says: 'they showed me some old pictures. I was so small and cute when I was a baby.' It implies Uncle Ben showed Steven pictures of Steven as a baby, not that he bought pictures *for* Steven. Therefore, (C) is not right.

title: Reading 11: Homonyms
article:
Hi, everyone. Today's English class is about homonyms. Before we talk about homonyms, let's read a story first.
It was a cold and rainy night. Jasper was on his way home. There was an old man walking in front of him. "Watch out!" said Jasper to the old man when he saw a car. But, it was too late. The car hit the old man, and he lost his left arm and left leg. A few weeks later, Jasper saw the old man on the street again. "Hey, are you okay?" Jasper walked to the old man. "Well, I am all right now," said the old man. He showed Jasper his right arm and right leg.
In the story, the "right" in "all right" and the "right" in "his right arm and right leg" are homonyms. They have the same spelling but do not mean the same thing. One is "fine" or "okay," and the other is "on the right hand side." Now, can you think of another example of homonyms?

subQuestions.q: What do we know from the story?
options: (B) Jasper's car hit the old man.
(C) The weather that night was nice.
(D) The old man only has one arm and one leg now.
subQuestions.explanation: The story states: 'The car hit the old man, and he lost his left arm and left leg.' He showed Jasper his 'right arm and right leg' saying he is 'all right'. This implies he only has the right ones left.

subQuestions.q:
Which uses homonyms?
a. What do you call hot snow? Water.
b. Why wasn't the moon hungry? Because it was full.
c. Why does every girl hate the sun? Because it is not cool.
d. What goes up when the rain comes down? An umbrella.
subQuestions.explanation:
Homonyms are words with same spelling but different meanings.
b. 'Full' means the moon phase is full, and also means not hungry.
c. 'Cool' means low temperature, and also means fashionable/popular.
a and d are just riddles without wordplay on double meanings. Thus, b and c use homonyms.

title: Reading 12: Sally and Eric
article:
Sally: How's your trip to Kaohsiung?
Eric: Very good. It is hot and sunny.
Sally: Really? It rains a lot in Keelung today.
Eric: Is it cold and windy, too?
Sally: Yes, we have heavy rain and strong winds. I visited my grandmother this morning. She lives on the next street. I hate rainy days. How about you?
Eric: I love walking in the rain, but there isn't much rain here in winter.
Sally: Well, I don't like the rain.
Eric: Let's visit Kaohsiung together next time. I can show you around. It is always sunny here.
Sally: Great! That's kind of you!

subQuestions.q: How is the weather at Sally's place?
subQuestions.explanation: Sally says: 'It rains a lot in Keelung today.' and 'we have heavy rain'. So it is rainy.

subQuestions.q: What does Eric like?
subQuestions.explanation: Eric says: 'I love walking in the rain'. This indicates he likes rainy days.

subQuestions.q: Which is true(正確的)?
options: (A) Sally likes the rain very much.
(B) Eric will visit Sally this weekend.
(C) It is always sunny in Kaohsiung.
(D) There is no rain in Keelung today.
subQuestions.explanation: Eric mentions at the end: 'I can show you around. It is always sunny here [Kaohsiung].' This makes (C) true.

title: Reading 13: Grandma's Birthday
article:
Apr. 24, Friday, 2020
I visited Grandma today. Aunt Sharon, Uncle Tom and Vicky were also there because it was Grandma's birthday. Aunt Sharon made a big chocolate cake for Grandma. It was beautiful, and Grandma liked it a lot! Uncle Tom just came back from Japan. He bought us cookies from Japan and showed us the pictures during his trip. Uncle Jack went on a business trip to Australia and didn't join us. He sent Grandma a postcard and a cool jacket as her birthday gift. Vicky and I made Grandma a cute birthday card. We saw a big smile on Grandma's face all day today.

subQuestions.q: How was the weather?
subQuestions.explanation: The diary header shows an icon of a Sun and '2°C'. 2°C is cold, and the Sun implies it is sunny.

subQuestions.q: What did Aunt Sharon make for the writer's grandma?
subQuestions.explanation: The text says: 'Aunt Sharon made a big chocolate cake for Grandma.'

subQuestions.q: Which is right?
options: (A) The writer's grandma got a postcard from Japan.
(B) Vicky visited her uncle in Australia.
(C) Uncle Tom showed a jacket to everyone.
(D) Vicky and the writer made a card for the writer's grandma.
subQuestions.explanation: The text states: 'Vicky and I made Grandma a cute birthday card.' This matches option (D). (A) is wrong because the postcard was from Australia (Uncle Jack). (C) is wrong because Uncle Tom showed pictures, not a jacket.

title: Reading 14: Message to Vivian
article:
Vivian,
You're so busy these days. I called you a few times, but there was no answer. Anyway, Jimmy and I are in Japan now.
It's cold and snowy and Jimmy is very happy. I bought a new snowboard for him. He likes it a lot! We visited Mr. and Mrs. Horiuchi, Mom and Dad's old friends. They were really nice. They gave heavy jackets to us and made us fantastic food. It was yummy and beautiful.
Right, I got a cute pencil for you and Jimmy sent you a postcard. There are pictures of Mountain Fuji on them. By the way, you can join Jimmy's birthday party, right? Talk to you soon.
Tony

subQuestions.q: What did Tony buy for Vivian?
subQuestions.explanation: Tony writes: 'I got a cute pencil for you'. So he bought a pencil.

subQuestions.q: What does fantastic mean?
subQuestions.explanation: Tony describes the food as 'fantastic' and then adds 'It was yummy and beautiful.' 'Yummy and beautiful' are positive adjectives, similar to 'Great'.

subQuestions.q: What might Jimmy write on the postcard?
options: (A) Hi, Aunt Vivian, Dad and I are in Japan now. It's snowy here, so Dad bought me a cool snowboard. Dad bought a cute pencil for you. We went to Mr. and Mrs. Horiuchi's house. They gave heavy jackets to us because our jackets weren't warm enough. That's kind of them! See you soon! Jimmy

(B) Dear Vivian, How are you doing? I got your postcard from Japan. Thanks a lot! That's so nice of you! We work very hard every day. Tony cooks for Mr. and Mrs. Horiuchi, and I order snowboards for old people. When we visit Mountain Fuji, let's have dinner together! Jimmy

(C) Aunt Vivian, How's everything? Mr. and Mrs. Horiuchi loved the cake. Thank you for buying the cake for them. They gave you a heavy jacket and a snowboard as gifts. Come to Japan and visit us next time! Jimmy

(D) Dear Vivian, How's the weather there? It's windy. I got a new snowboard from Tony, and it's beautiful. There are pictures of Mountain Fuji on it. My friend, Mr. and Mrs. Horiuchi gave a cute pencil to us and bought heavy jackets for you. How nice! See you at Tony's birthday party soon! Jimmy
subQuestions.explanation: Option (A) accurately reflects the details in Tony's message: Jimmy is in Japan with Dad (Tony), got a snowboard, Dad bought a pencil for Vivian, and the Horiuchis gave them jackets. The other options contain incorrect details (e.g., Vivian buying cake, Horiuchi giving pencils, ordering snowboards for old people).

title: Reading 15: Group Chat
article:
Good morning
Kelly: Good morning
Yuki: Morning.
Derek: Morning. What's the weather like in your places now?
Kelly: It's still sunny and hot in Tainan.
Derek: Sunny and hot in November?
Kelly: Yes. It's like in summer. What about Ben and Yuki?
Ben: It was cool yesterday, but today it's cold.
Derek: Is there any snow in Japan?
Ben: No. There is no snow, but the wind is strong.
Yuki: It's cool here in Thailand. How's the weather there, Derek?
Derek: It's so cold today. It's snowing now.
Kelly: Then you can have a white Christmas again this year.
Ben: White Christmas! I like it.
Yuki: Kelly, you can say that again. What about coming to New York this December?
Kelly: I would like to, but I can't. I have to work.
Derek: I want to go to New York for the white Christmas this December. Can I stay in your place, Derek?
Ben: Can I, Derek?
Derek: Sure.
Yuki: Thank you. Then Ben, Derek, and I can have fun in the snow.
Kelly: I envy you, Ben and Yuki. I can't be in the snow world with you three.
Ben: Don't be sad.

subQuestions.q: How is the weather in Japan today?
subQuestions.explanation: In the chat, Derek asks 'Is there any snow in Japan?'. The reply is 'No. There is no snow, but the wind is strong.' And earlier 'today it's cold'. So Japan is windy and cold.

subQuestions.q: Who CAN'T enjoy the white Christmas this year?
subQuestions.explanation: Kelly says: 'I would like to, but I can't. I have to work.' So she cannot go to New York for the white Christmas.

subQuestions.q: What place is there?
subQuestions.explanation: The conversation context involves visiting Derek. Derek invites them to 'New York'. So 'there' refers to Derek's place, which is New York.

subQuestions.q: Which is true?
options: (B) It is snowy in Japan in November.
(C) Yuki can meet Ben in the USA on Christmas.
(D) Ben can stay in Derek's place, but Yuki can't.
subQuestions.explanation: Both Yuki and Ben agree to go to New York (USA) to visit Derek. Therefore, they can meet there on Christmas. (A) is false as Kelly says 'White Christmas! I like it.' (B) is false as it says 'No snow'. (D) is false as Derek says 'Sure' to Yuki staying.

title: Reading 16: Jane and Douglas
article:
Jane: How many seasons are there in a year?
Douglas: There are four.
Jane: Which one do you like most?
Douglas: I like the winter.
Jane: Why? Don't you feel cold and bad in winter?
Douglas: I don't like hot weather. I like cold weather.
Jane: I hate cold days.
Douglas: I'll visit my aunt in Singapore this winter. It is usually warm in winter. Do you want to take a trip to Singapore with me?
Jane: Sounds like a good idea!
Douglas: I usually have a good time there. My aunt, uncle and cousins are nice. Look! This is a picture of them.
Jane: Wow! Your cousins are so cute!
Douglas: You're right.
Jane: Why were you in a pink T-shirt? You don't like pink.
Douglas: It's my uncle's. I didn't bring enough T-shirts with me.

subQuestions.q: Which is right?
options: (B) The pink T-shirt was a birthday gift from Douglas' uncle.
subQuestions.explanation: Douglas says: 'I'll visit my aunt in Singapore this winter.' So (D) is right. (A) is wrong (he likes winter). (C) is wrong (Jane hates cold).

subQuestions.q: Jane thought it sounded like a good idea to have a trip to Singapore in winter. Why?
options: (B) It's warm in Singapore in winter.
(D) She usually has a good time there.
subQuestions.explanation: Jane hates cold days. Douglas says Singapore is 'usually warm in winter'. Jane then says 'Sounds like a good idea'. So she likes it because it is warm.

title: Reading 17: Vincent and Lillian
article:
Vincent: What do you do on weekends?
Lillian: I usually play basketball with my classmates. How about you?
Vincent: My parents and I often fly a kite at the beach.
Lillian: How's the weather today?
Vincent: It is warm but windy.
Lillian: Great! Let's go fly a kite now.
Vincent: OK! But we need to take our umbrellas.
Lillian: Why?
Vincent: The weather report says it will be rainy later.
Lillian: Oh, no. Then, how about going to a movie?
Vincent: That's fine with me.

subQuestions.q: Lillian said, "Let's go fly a kite now." Why?
options: (C) Because Vincent gave her a kite.
(D) Because her classmates are flying a kite.
subQuestions.explanation: Vincent says the weather is 'warm but windy'. Lillian suggests flying a kite because wind is needed for kites.

subQuestions.q: What are Vincent and Lillian going to do later?
options: (A) Watch the weather report on TV.
subQuestions.explanation: Since the weather report says it will rain later, Lillian says 'how about going to a movie?' and Vincent agrees ('That's fine with me').

subQuestions.q: What might the weather report say?
options: (A) It's a hot sunny day today. Leave(留下) your heavy jackets at home!
(B) There's a lot of rain all day, and it's cold. Take an umbrella with you.
(C) It's warm but windy early this morning, but there's rain later this afternoon. You will need a jacket and an umbrella then.
(D) It's cold but sunny today, a good weather for exercise. Enjoy!
subQuestions.explanation: The conversation reveals it is currently warm and windy, but will be rainy later. Option (C) matches this forecast perfectly.

title: Reading 18: Surfing and Skiing

subQuestions.q: What DON'T people wear to go skiing?
subQuestions.explanation: In the chart under Skiing, item 4 lists: 'Wear warm jackets, warm gloves and snow pants.' Swimsuits are listed under Surfing. So people don't wear swimsuits for skiing.

subQuestions.q: Which is right?
options: (A) People in the old time didn't surf.
(D) We can surf at the place with a lot of snow.
subQuestions.explanation: The chart shows 'Skiboard' under the picture for Skiing. (A) is wrong because surfing was part of old Polynesian culture. (B) describes surfing weather. (D) describes skiing location.

subQuestions.q: Why did the Sami ski?
subQuestions.explanation: The chart states: 'The Sami (Lapps) said they were the inventors of skiing, and they skied to hunt.'

title: Reading 19: Ann and Ken
article:
Ann: Hi, Ken! How was your trip to Taiwan?
Ken: It was great! The weather was good, so I visited a lot of beautiful places.
Ann: That's cool!
Ken: Right, I went to Yangmingshan and bought flowers for my Taiwanese friend there.
Ann: Really?
Ken: Here's a picture of my friend and me.
Ann: Wow! The flowers were really beautiful.
Ken: You can say that again.
Ann: Why were you in a pink T-shirt? You hate pink.
Ken: It was hot, but my T-shirts were heavy. My friend bought some cool T-shirts for me, and the pink T-shirt is one of them. They were my birthday gifts!
Ann: How nice!
Ken: Did you get my postcard from Taiwan?
Ann: Yes, I got it last week.

subQuestions.q: What did Ken's friends buy for his birthday?
subQuestions.explanation: Ken says: 'My friend bought some cool T-shirts for me... They were my birthday gifts!'

subQuestions.q: Which is right?
options: (A) Ann had a trip to Taiwan.
(C) Ken bought flowers for Ann in Yangminshan.
(D) Ann got a postcard from Ken.
subQuestions.explanation: Ken asks: 'Did you get my postcard...?' Ann answers: 'Yes, I got it last week.' So (D) is right.

subQuestions.q: Which might be the conversation(對話) between Ken and his Taiwanese friend?
options: (A) Ken: Hello, Tina. Here are some pictures for you. Happy Birthday! Tina: Thanks!
(B) Ken: It's so cold and it's rainy! Tina: Winter's not a good season for trips. We have a lot of rain and it's cold. Don't go to the mountains these days.
(C) Tina: Happy Birthday, Ken. Ken: Can I open the gift now? Tina: Sure. Ken: Wow! T-shirts. That's kind of you. Thank you!
(D) Ken: Wow! The flowers here are beautiful. Tina: Yes, they are. Here are some flowers for you! Ken: Thank you.
subQuestions.explanation: Ken mentions his friend gave him T-shirts as birthday gifts. Option (C) depicts this scenario where Tina (friend) gives Ken a gift, and it turns out to be T-shirts.

title: Reading 20: Fruit Recipes

subQuestions.q: Which recipe DOESN'T need salt?
subQuestions.explanation: Checking the recipes: Strawberries (chocolate) - No salt. Watermelons - needs salt. Apples - needs salt. Pumpkins - needs salt. So (A) is the answer.

subQuestions.q: What can we know from the reading?
options: (A) We can eat yummy fruits in Taiwan.
(B) We don't need pepper for the recipe of pumpkins.
(C) We need sugar to make strawberries with chocolate.
(D) We can also put watermelon pieces on the apple pizza.
subQuestions.explanation: The introduction says 'Taiwan is famous for its yummy fruits.' (B) is wrong (pumpkins need pepper). (C) is wrong (strawberries need chocolate, not added sugar explicitly mentioned). (D) is not mentioned. So (A) is correct.

subQuestions.q: Which one had the apple pizza?
options: (A) Peter: Wow! It was so sweet and cool. I want to have it on every hot summer day!
(B) Judy: My friend and I had them together. We put so many in the pot. It was really fun.
(C) Lisa: I baked some for my salad. The salad was yummy and beautiful with them.
(D) Owen: This recipe is easy. My wife and I really enjoyed a pizza like this as our afternoon tea.
subQuestions.explanation: The 'Apples in fall' recipe is for making an 'apple pizza'. Owen explicitly mentions enjoying 'a pizza like this', which directly links to the apple recipe.
